refnamediv.refpurpose: is a GTK+ text editor for ebook PDF files.

refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para: This manual page documents briefly the &dhpackage; and bar commands.
&dhpackage; is a GTK+ text editor for ebook PDF files.

Many downloaded PDF files for ebook readers still use the A4 paper type (or letter which is similar in size) and when the PDF is displayed on the ebook reader, the zoom required to display the entire page makes the text too small. Simply exporting the PDF into text causes problems with line wrapping and the various ways that ebook PDFs indicate page headers and footers make it hard to automate the conversion.
&dhpackage; loads the PDF, extracts the text, reformats the paragraphs into single long lines and then puts the text into a standard GTK+ editor where you can make other adjustments.
On the ebook reader, the plain text file then has no unwanted line breaks and can be zoomed to whatever text size you prefer.

refsect1.title: Limitations
refsect1.para: ebook PDF files often contain headers and footers - chapter and book titles as well as page numbers. These count as part of the text of the PDF file and are retained by &dhpackage;. As these are often specific to any one book, it is hard to reliably remove these and yet the insertions will disrupt the flow of the text.
Currently, the only solution is to edit the text before saving.

If the text from the PDF cannot be reliably converted into ASCII text, the text will be omitted, usually one page at a time - more examples of PDF files that suffer from these issues would be helpful.

refsect1.title: Future additions
refsect1.para: The plan is to enable &dhpackage; to also save the modified text as a new PDF file as well as saving as a normal ASCII text file.
Other ebook formats might be supportable, depending on whether there is free software support for reading the format in the first place.

Some form of search/replace will be needed in the editor as well - more than just the default Find and Find Next. Spelling support could also help identify areas where the text has not been fully reconstructed.

refsect1.title: OPTIONS
refsect1.para: There are no command-line options supported.
PDF files passed on the command line will be opened by &dhpackage;.
